titlestmt.titleproper: American Institute of Chemical Engineers records 1925-1998
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Institute of Chemical Engineers records

bioghist.p: American Institute of Chemical Engineers (AIChE) was formed in 1908 to foster professional development and encourage communication among members of the chemical engineering profession. The organization has 18 divisions and forums which focus on specific areas of chemical engineering. AIChE publishes various journals, and holds annual meetings at which members and guest experts present papers.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of selected records from the AIChE. The materials fall into four broad groups: local section histories; abstracts of papers given at the 73rd annual meeting; materials gathered from the chemical engineering departments of universities and other institutions for a history project entitled "Beginning of Chemical Engineering in U.S.A."; and a time capsule of materials on the occasion of the organization's diamond jubilee. Also included in the collection are AIChE membership directories, by-laws, brochures on chemical engineering careers, and other miscellaneous AIChE materials.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
